medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient initially presented with serum triglycerides of 4740 mg/dL at age 23, 3 weeks postpartum. Over 35 years, has experienced recurrent episodes of extreme hypertriglyceridemia, with fasting serum triglycerides exceeding 2000 mg/dL. Symptoms were aggravated by a high fat diet and lapses in medication compliance, but improved with dietary reduction and antihyperlipidemic therapies.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of recurrent extreme hypertriglyceridemia. No history of diabetes mellitus, coronary heart disease, or acute pancreatitis. Mention of estrogen use during the episodes, but no significant prior surgeries.
medical_history.family_history: Father died at age 41 due to myocardial infarction; mother died at age 80 due to dementia-related complications. No family history of extreme hypertriglyceridemia specified.
medical_history.social_history: Patient denied alcohol use and smoking; admitted to consuming a high fat diet.
